projectPurpose: To provide an experimental cross-platform graphical user interface (GUI) toolkit in the form of a Rust crate.
mainFeatures: Provides a graphical user interface (GUI) toolkit

alternatives.name: Relm4
mainFeatures: Idiomatic GUI library based on gtk4-rs

alternatives.name: gtk-rs
mainFeatures: Supports a wide range of widgets

alternatives.name: Slint
alternatives.license: Open Source (GPL, royalty-free for desktop/mobile), Proprietary

alternatives.name: cxx-qt
mainFeatures: Create bidirectional Rust ↔ C++ bindings with Qt
Integrate Rust into C++ or build Rust applications with Cargo
Safe communication between Rust and C++ using CXX

marketPositioning: "gooey" is positioned as an experimental, early-stage cross-platform GUI library for Rust. Unlike more established Rust GUI options or bindings to mature toolkits, it is still in active development and exploration. Its position is currently niche within the Rust GUI ecosystem, appealing to developers interested in contributing to or experimenting with new GUI paradigms in Rust. Its future market standing will depend on its progress, unique features, and community adoption compared to more mature and widely used alternatives like Iced, egui, and gtk-rs, or even solutions leveraging existing frameworks like Qt via cxx-qt.
